title: How England can kick the All Blacks to distraction and reach the Rugby World Cup final
text:
For England to beat New Zealand, their kicking game must be perfect. We like to think the World Cup will be won by free-flowing, all-court ball handling. The reality is that most of the best handling phases and chances to score tries will emanate from kicks, kick chases or kick pressure. If a team does not handle all the points around its kicking game and its kick defence then they will lose the territory battle, will come under pressure and almost certainly lose.

Last week, Wales' second-rate kicking game early on in the match against France nearly cost them the victory. Similarly,...
description: For England to beat New Zealand, their kicking game must be perfect.
